description: Optical Metro enterprise event trap. This trap is sent
whenever an Optical Metro event is raised.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::eventTrap NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logIndex c 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfSiteId i 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfShelfId i 1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logSlotNum i 0 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logTimeStamp i 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifEventDescr s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmCardType i 0 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifLocationDescr s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logOptSysId s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logClass i 1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logUpsnNum i 0

description: A unique entry in the log table. As new entries are
added to the log, this index will increase to the
maximum size of Counter, then wrap to 0. Note that
although the index into the table continues to grow, the
table size (number of entries) will only grow to the
maximum given by logMaxSize, after which the oldest entry
will be removed to make room for a new entry. Thereafter
the table will always be the size given by logMaxSize. In
other words, this table is implemented as a sliding
window, with the oldest events dropping off the end of the
table as newer events occur. The manager should poll the
value of logCurrentIndex to see whether new entries have
been added into the table.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logIndex

description: Specifies the site identifier configured for this shelf.
This number is assigned once at commissioning time and is
used to allocate IP addresses. It should not be changed
once configured.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfSiteId

description: Specifies a unique shelf identifier configured for this
shelf. This number is assigned once at commissioning time
and is used to allocate internal IP addresses within the
shelf. It should not be changed once configured.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfShelfId

description: The slot number related to this log entry, if applicable.
This variable is only applicable if the event is an alarm
state change or event. If the slot number is not
applicable, it is set to 0.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logSlotNum

description: The time and date this log entry was created. This
timestamp matches the timestamp sent out in the trap which
occurred to inform the manager of the event.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logTimeStamp

description: A text string describing the event.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifEventDescr

description: Specifies the provisioned card type of this alarm. If the card
type is not applicable, it is set to undefine(0).
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmCardType

description: A comma-separated string describing the location
information about this alarm. It will be in the
following format:
slot:<>, port:<>, portType:<>, direction:<>, ringNumber:<>
where:
Slot number has a range [0..47]
Port number has a range [0..48], 1-8 for optical, 1-18 for backplane,
1-2 for wan, 1-48 for paths, 1 for aggregate
Port type is one of: 0(nil), 1(optical), 2(back plane), 3(wan), 4(path)
5(aggregate)
Direction is one of: 0(n/a), 1(tx), 2(rx)
Ring number has a range [0..63]
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifLocationDescr

description: Optical System Id descriptor.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logOptSysId

description: This variable identifies the class of log entry, i.e.
whether this log entry is for an alarm, an event, or a
user provisioning request.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logClass

description: Specifies the IP address of this shelf. This address is
actually the IP address of Ethernet Port 1.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfIpAddress

description: This shall be applicable if the log was generated while the
UPSN feature was turned on the shelf; otherwise, it shall be zero.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logUpsnNum

description: Optical Metro enterprise user request trap. This trap is sent
whenever an SNMP SET request is received by the agent.
NOTE: When setting PM thresholds logSlotNum does not
represent slot number, but in fact it represents a
location. For more information on how location
is defined look at a definition of OPTeraLocation

Summary.eval: ($v6 ne '') ? '$v6' : 'Optical Metro enterprise user request trap'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::userRequestTrap NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logIndex c 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfSiteId i 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfShelfId i 1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logSlotNum i 0 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logTimeStamp i 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logDescr s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logUserRequestRc i 0 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmCardType i 0 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifLocationDescr s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logOptSysId s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logClass i 1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logUpsnNum i 0

description: A unique entry in the log table. As new entries are
added to the log, this index will increase to the
maximum size of Counter, then wrap to 0. Note that
although the index into the table continues to grow, the
table size (number of entries) will only grow to the
maximum given by logMaxSize, after which the oldest entry
will be removed to make room for a new entry. Thereafter
the table will always be the size given by logMaxSize. In
other words, this table is implemented as a sliding
window, with the oldest events dropping off the end of the
table as newer events occur. The manager should poll the
value of logCurrentIndex to see whether new entries have
been added into the table.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logIndex

description: Specifies the site identifier configured for this shelf.
This number is assigned once at commissioning time and is
used to allocate IP addresses. It should not be changed
once configured.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfSiteId

description: Specifies a unique shelf identifier configured for this
shelf. This number is assigned once at commissioning time
and is used to allocate internal IP addresses within the
shelf. It should not be changed once configured.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfShelfId

description: The slot number related to this log entry, if applicable.
This variable is only applicable if the event is an alarm
state change or event. If the slot number is not
applicable, it is set to 0.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logSlotNum

description: The time and date this log entry was created. This
timestamp matches the timestamp sent out in the trap which
occurred to inform the manager of the event.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logTimeStamp

description: A textual description of the logged event.
This description is set according to the logClass, as
follows:
alarm: the description as contained in the
notifAlarmDescr variable for the given alarm id
event: the description as contained in the
notifEventDescr variable for the given event id
userReq: a string of the following format:
'<ip address>, <username>, <description>, <PASS|FAIL>'
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logDescr

description: The return code from the user request, if applicable.
The manager can consult this log entry to find out why a
set request failed. If this log entry is not of a userReq
class, this variable is set to opt-ok(1).
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logUserRequestRc

description: Specifies the provisioned card type of this alarm. If the card
type is not applicable, it is set to undefine(0).
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmCardType

description: A comma-separated string describing the location
information about this alarm. It will be in the
following format:
slot:<>, port:<>, portType:<>, direction:<>, ringNumber:<>
where:
Slot number has a range [0..47]
Port number has a range [0..48], 1-8 for optical, 1-18 for backplane,
1-2 for wan, 1-48 for paths, 1 for aggregate
Port type is one of: 0(nil), 1(optical), 2(back plane), 3(wan), 4(path)
5(aggregate)
Direction is one of: 0(n/a), 1(tx), 2(rx)
Ring number has a range [0..63]
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifLocationDescr

description: Optical System Id descriptor.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logOptSysId

description: This variable identifies the class of log entry, i.e.
whether this log entry is for an alarm, an event, or a
user provisioning request.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logClass

description: Specifies the IP address of this shelf. This address is
actually the IP address of Ethernet Port 1.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfIpAddress

description: This shall be applicable if the log was generated while the
UPSN feature was turned on the shelf; otherwise, it shall be zero.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logUpsnNum

description: Optical Metro enterprise alarm trap. This trap is sent
whenever an alarm of 'critical' severity changes state.
NOTE: By looking at OID related to notifAlarmTimeStamp,
notifAlarmState or notifAlarmDescr variables it is
possible to get a location. Assuming notifAlarmTimeStamp
The second dot separated number from the end refers
to location. The same is for notifAlarmState and
notifAlarmDescr

Summary.eval: ($v6 ne '') ? '$v6' : 'Optical Metro enterprise critical alarm state changed to $v5'

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::alarmCriticalTrap NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logIndex c 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfSiteId i 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfShelfId i 1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmTimeStamp i 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmState i 0 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmDescr s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmCardType i 0 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifLocationDescr s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifOptSysId s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logClass i 1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmUpsnNum i 0

$SNMPTRAPCMD NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::alarmCriticalTrap NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logIndex c 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfSiteId i 9888 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfShelfId i 2 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmTimeStamp i 9999 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmState i 1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmDescr s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmCardType i 0 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifLocationDescr s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifOptSysId s EXAMPLE NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logClass i 2 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmUpsnNum i 0

description: A unique entry in the log table. As new entries are
added to the log, this index will increase to the
maximum size of Counter, then wrap to 0. Note that
although the index into the table continues to grow, the
table size (number of entries) will only grow to the
maximum given by logMaxSize, after which the oldest entry
will be removed to make room for a new entry. Thereafter
the table will always be the size given by logMaxSize. In
other words, this table is implemented as a sliding
window, with the oldest events dropping off the end of the
table as newer events occur. The manager should poll the
value of logCurrentIndex to see whether new entries have
been added into the table.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logIndex

description: Specifies the site identifier configured for this shelf.
This number is assigned once at commissioning time and is
used to allocate IP addresses. It should not be changed
once configured.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfSiteId

description: Specifies a unique shelf identifier configured for this
shelf. This number is assigned once at commissioning time
and is used to allocate internal IP addresses within the
shelf. It should not be changed once configured.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfShelfId

description: Specifies the time and date when this alarm last changed
state.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmTimeStamp

description: A qualifier for the current state of this alarm. The
alarm can be clear, active or intermittent.
Enumeration is like this:
undefined(0)
clear(1),
intermittent(2)
active(3)
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmState

description: A text string describing the alarm.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmDescr

description: Specifies the provisioned card type of this alarm. If the card
type is not applicable, it is set to undefine(0).
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmCardType

description: A comma-separated string describing the location
information about this alarm. It will be in the
following format:
slot:<>, port:<>, portType:<>, direction:<>, ringNumber:<>
where:
Slot number has a range [0..47]
Port number has a range [0..48], 1-8 for optical, 1-18 for backplane,
1-2 for wan, 1-48 for paths, 1 for aggregate
Port type is one of: 0(nil), 1(optical), 2(back plane), 3(wan), 4(path)
5(aggregate)
Direction is one of: 0(n/a), 1(tx), 2(rx)
Ring number has a range [0..63]
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifLocationDescr

description: Optical System Id descriptor. It is a string that is up to 8 character long for line cards
and up to 17 character for OSC.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifOptSysId

description: This variable identifies the class of log entry, i.e.
whether this log entry is for an alarm, an event, or a
user provisioning request.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logClass

description: Specifies the IP address of this shelf. This address is
actually the IP address of Ethernet Port 1.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfIpAddress

description: This value would be applicable if the alarm is raised when
UPSN is enabled on the shelf. It would be 0 otherwise.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmUpsnNum

description: Optical enterprise alarm trap. This trap is sent
whenever an alarm of 'major' severity changes state.
NOTE: By looking at OID related to notifAlarmTimeStamp,
notifAlarmState or notifAlarmDescr variables it is
possible to get a location. Assuming notifAlarmTimeStamp
The second dot separated number from the end refers
to location. The same is for notifAlarmState and
notifAlarmDescr

Summary.eval: ($v6 ne '') ? '$v6' : 'Optical Metro enterprise major alarm state changed to $v5'

description: A unique entry in the log table. As new entries are
added to the log, this index will increase to the
maximum size of Counter, then wrap to 0. Note that
although the index into the table continues to grow, the
table size (number of entries) will only grow to the
maximum given by logMaxSize, after which the oldest entry
will be removed to make room for a new entry. Thereafter
the table will always be the size given by logMaxSize. In
other words, this table is implemented as a sliding
window, with the oldest events dropping off the end of the
table as newer events occur. The manager should poll the
value of logCurrentIndex to see whether new entries have
been added into the table.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logIndex

description: Specifies the site identifier configured for this shelf.
This number is assigned once at commissioning time and is
used to allocate IP addresses. It should not be changed
once configured.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfSiteId

description: Specifies a unique shelf identifier configured for this
shelf. This number is assigned once at commissioning time
and is used to allocate internal IP addresses within the
shelf. It should not be changed once configured.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfShelfId

description: Specifies the time and date when this alarm last changed
state.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmTimeStamp

description: A qualifier for the current state of this alarm. The
alarm can be clear, active or intermittent.
Enumeration is like this:
undefined(0)
clear(1),
intermittent(2)
active(3)
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmState

description: A text string describing the alarm.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifAlarmDescr

description: Specifies the provisioned card type of this alarm. If the card
type is not applicable, it is set to undefine(0).
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmCardType

description: A comma-separated string describing the location
information about this alarm. It will be in the
following format:
slot:<>, port:<>, portType:<>, direction:<>, ringNumber:<>
where:
Slot number has a range [0..47]
Port number has a range [0..48], 1-8 for optical, 1-18 for backplane,
1-2 for wan, 1-48 for paths, 1 for aggregate
Port type is one of: 0(nil), 1(optical), 2(back plane), 3(wan), 4(path)
5(aggregate)
Direction is one of: 0(n/a), 1(tx), 2(rx)
Ring number has a range [0..63]
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifLocationDescr

description: Optical System Id descriptor. It is a string that is up to 8 character long for line cards
and up to 17 character for OSC.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifOptSysId

description: This variable identifies the class of log entry, i.e.
whether this log entry is for an alarm, an event, or a
user provisioning request.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::logClass

description: Specifies the IP address of this shelf. This address is
actually the IP address of Ethernet Port 1.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::shelfIpAddress

description: This value would be applicable if the alarm is raised when
UPSN is enabled on the shelf. It would be 0 otherwise.
variables.name: NORTEL-OPTICAL-METRO-PUB-MIB::notifActiveAlarmUpsnNum

description: Optical Metro enterprise alarm trap. This trap is sent
whenever an 'alert' changes state.
NOTE: By looking at OID related to notifAlarmTimeStamp,
notifAlarmState or notifAlarmDescr variables it is
possible to get a location. Assuming notifAlarmTimeStamp
The second dot separated number from the end refers
to location. The same is for notifAlarmState and
notifAlarmDescr

Summary.eval: ($v6 ne '') ? '$v6' : 'Optical Metro enterprise alert state changed to $v5'
